Comment: Here's a little exercise to ask Pam:   Last year, Americans drank 4.5 liters of wine per person, on average.   Not everyone of course, and not all in one sitting of course, but averaged out over all americans and over the whole year.   As it turns out, that's crudely estimated to be just about what it takes to kill a person :  5 liters of wine, but you gotta drink it inside an hour.  [source](https://www.northstarbehavioralhealthmn.com/resources/how-much-alcohol-can-kill-you). (yes lots of variables there, but we are doing ballpark math here)   So if we use Bondi's math as applied to fentanyl,  **everyone in america died last year of alcohol poisoning just from wine.**     Let's not even talk about beer and spirits.    So explain this, PAM:  how are any of us still alive?
